channel.title: Battlefield 1943 Canceled
channel.description:
Battlefield 1943 for PC has been canceled, as has the PC version of Battlefield: Bad Company 2’s co-op DLC, Onslaught, developer DICE announced today.
Read more: http://www.g4tv.com/thefeed/blog/post/710183/Battlefield-1943-PC-Canceled.html#ixzz1CvavZTg8

item.title: Battlefield 1943 Canceled
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Play.com have never taken my money for a Pre-order until they’ve shipped it to me

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield 1943 Canceled
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I didn’t think that was how it worked, I’ve seen people complaining about their pre-orders because they took the money and didn’t do anything. I’ve never actually pre-ordered anything though, if I want a game when it’s released, I just go to the store.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield 1943 Canceled
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:3, topic:381067”]I totally didn’t ever suspect that this would happen at all… :rolleyes:

Fucking EA. I wonder what happens to all the thousands of people that pre-ordered BF1943, do they get their money back with interest?[/quote]
afaik pre orders dont take your money until its shipped to you

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield 1943 Canceled
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I am too, but I can almost guarantee they won’t pay interest. I wonder if they are even refunding anything at all. Can anyone find articles about it?

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield 1943 Canceled
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Fucking EA. I wonder what happens to all the thousands of people that pre-ordered BF1943, do they get their money back with interest?

Yeah no doubt; EA has obviously been using that money to invest, r&d, etc. It wouldn’t be fair if they didn’t pay interest. I’m being 100 percent serious.

Read full topic
